title: Ann-Kio Briggs
text:
Ann-Kio Briggs, alternatively spelled Annkio Briggs, (born 29th of July,1952) <a href="England">England</a>,She is an English-born <a href="Nigerians">Nigerian</a> environmental and human rights activist. She is the founder and executive director of <a href="non-governmental%20organization">non-governmental organization</a> Agape Birthrights. As of 2011, she was spokesperson of the Ijaw Republican Assembly (IRA) as well as the United Niger Delta Energy Development Security Strategy (UNDEDSS).
Biography.
Briggs was born on 29th of July,1952 in <a href="England">England</a>. She was born to a <a href="British%20people">British</a> mother and an <a href="Ijaw%20people">Ijaw</a> marine <a href="engineer">engineer</a>. At an early age, she was taken to live with her paternal grandmother who raised her alongside her father in <a href="Abonnema">Abonnema</a>, <a href="Rivers%20State">Rivers State</a>. While there, she finished her elementary school years and enrolled at <a href="Holy%20Rosary%20College">Holy Rosary Girls School</a> in <a href="Port%20Harcourt">Port Harcourt</a> for her secondary <a href="education">education</a>. From (1967 to 1970), her academic studies were impeded by the <a href="Nigerian%20Civil%20War">civil war</a>, and after it ended, Briggs moved with her family to <a href="England">England</a> where she studied Marketing. In 1998, after several years in Europe, she returned to the <a href="Niger%20Delta">Niger Delta</a> and established Agape Birthrights, a non-governmental and a non-profit organization,having its headquarter in <a href="D-line%2C%20Port%20Harcourt">D-line</a> <a href="Rivers%20State">Rivers State</a>. Briggs, through her organization she has helped some developing areas to documents cleaning of oil spillage and fighting against injustices and marginalisation. She also collaborates internationally with other organizations from around the world.
Personal life.
Briggs married during her stay in <a href="England">England</a>. She and her husband had four children together and divorced in 1998. As well as her native <a href="Kalabari%20language">Kalabari</a>, Briggs is fluent in <a href="Igbo%20language">Igbo</a> and also speaks <a href="Nigerian%20Pidgin">Pidgin English</a>.
